threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

exiftool.ImageFileCharacteristics: No relocs, Executable, No line numbers, No symbols, 32-bit

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls any any -> any any (msg:"SURICATA TLS certificate invalid der"; flow:established; app-layer-event:tls.certificate_invalid_der; flowint:tls.anomaly.count,+,1; classtype:protocol-command-decode; sid:2230027; rev:1;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe" /c powershell -window hidden -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=powershell  -window hidden -EncodedCommand  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

@{Details=C:\Users\george\Desktop\software.exe; EventType=SetValue; Image=c:\temp\rr.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1015118539-3749460369-599379286-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\iexplore}

@{Details=%SAMPLEPATH%\e57f77cc3d117923ec01aa0e044edc11b1042e57993ca7f74d971630893ca263.exe; EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\%SID%\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\iexplore}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=EB80BB1CA9B9C7F516FF69AFCFD75B7D,SHA256=38C407DBF41E99396B78D00DD796930D8838DCB4AF77C3F23BA0E800D1213EBE,IMPHASH=950FB6F62526333E663D35BA72D19DDC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -enc  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\iptgvshw\iptgvshw.cmdline"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_oo4bedeh.wvu.ps1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_wrtdcdlx.f45.psm1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_winarier.uza.ps1}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\__PSScriptPolicyTest_iso0ewyh.a1o.psm1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\iptgvshw\iptgvshw.cmdline}
@{TargetFilename=%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp\grazhpkq.cmdline}

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and Base64 encoded PowerShell code that starts with a $ sign and a single char variable
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
